page.title: 03Housing and Health
page.content:
There are approximately 56 homes; the majority are farmhouses. Some have been converted from barns or derelict buildings; two are modern farm bungalows and one a mobile home. Few houses are tenanted, most families own their property; three are holiday homes. All houses have mains electricity. There is no piped gas. Isolated houses use spring water; Fellside, Greenrigg and Whelpo are on mains water. Sewerage is to septic tanks. The Lake District Special Planning Board oversees building and land use.
Health: The health centre for the area is two miles to the east, with three doctors and health visitors, working from a modern surgery. A home visiting service is available. Prescriptions are dispensed at the surgery.
